intro: Atitara philippiana, commonly known as the Philippine atitara, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in lowland forests. The fruit is a small, round drupe that can be edible, though some parts of the plant may contain irritants.
